@@ -95,24 +99,71 @@

Title Block

  • When a cell is selected, the content of the cell is displayed on the bottom of the table.

    • - + +

    +
      +
    • The content of each cell can be editable by double clicking on a cell.
      • +
    +

    + +

    +

    +
    + A new dialog is opened the fields below can be edited (we can edit the existing fields or add new values for the new cells):

      -
    • The content of each cell can be editable by double clicking on a cell. A new dialog is opened and can edit the fields below: +
    • name: enter the name(label) that will be displayed on the cell
      • +
    • content: type a query that will provide the content that we need to display in the cell of the Diagram Title Block. The content of data fields can be customized via:
        -
      • name: enter the name(label) that will be displayed on the cell
        • -
      • content: type a query that will provide the content that we need to display in the cell of the Diagram Title Block. The content of data fields can be customized via: -
          -
        • AQL query (aql:)
          • -
        • Name of feature (feature:)
          • -
        • Predefined service (capella:)
          • -
        -
        • +
      • AQL query (aql:)

nodes.bodyText: After edit editing or update updating the cells of a Diagram Title Block, we can save the changes by clicking the Apply buttons.

Title Block

  • When a cell is selected, the content of the cell is displayed on the bottom of the table.

    • name: enter the name(label) that will be displayed on the cell
      • +
    • content: type a query that will provide the content that we need to display in the cell of the Diagram Title Block. The content of data fields can be customized via:
        -
      • name: enter the name(label) that will be displayed on the cell
        • -
      • content: type a query that will provide the content that we need to display in the cell of the Diagram Title Block. The content of data fields can be customized via: -
          -
        • AQL query (aql:)
          • -

          • -
        -

      • AQL query (aql:)
        • +

    - + + +

nodes.bodyText:
This code should be added directly in org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.clipboard.actions.AbstractCopyPasteAction.getCopyPasteSelection().
Since both CapellaDiagramCopyAction and CapellaDiagramPasteAction inherit from that class, this avoids duplication. Furthermore this will solve the bug in org.polarsys.capella.core.platform.sirius.clipboard.actions.CapellaDiagramCopyAction.isEnabled()) which wrongfully reports that a copy paste is possible only to be executed on 0 elements afterwards.
